definitions: Hesitating or being unwilling to accept an idea or undertaking.
Preventing someone from doing something; thwarting.
In billiards, placing the cue ball behind the baulk line after a foul.
Of a horse, refusing to go on; stopping short and refusing to proceed.
examples: He was baulking at the idea of working overtime.
The government was baulking efforts to reform.
After the scratch, she was baulking the cue ball.
The horse was baulking at the jump.
